data.title: The Magical Tower
data.statement:
You are the elevator operator in a Magical Tower.

This is no ordinary tower! The magic level [[R]] on each floor gets stronger the higher you go. The wizard needs you to take him to a specific floor, but he only remembers the magic level [[R]].

You must calculate the correct Floor [[F]] so the elevator knows where to go.

The magic formula is:
[[R]] = [[F]]^2 + [[F]] × ⌊[[F]] / 7⌋

(Note: ⌊x⌋ means round down to the nearest whole number. For example, ⌊1.9⌋ is 1.)

Your Mission:
Given the magic level [[R]], find the correct Floor [[F]].
data.inputDescription: A string [[R]] representing the magic level (contains a 64-bit integer).
data.outputDescription: An integer [[F]] representing the floor number.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are the elevator operator in a Magical Tower.

This is no ordinary tower! The magic level R on each floor gets stronger the higher you go. The wizard needs you to take him to a specific floor, but he only remembers the magic level R.

You must calculate the correct Floor F so the elevator knows where to go.

The magic formula is:
R = F^2 + F × ⌊F / 7⌋

(Note: ⌊x⌋ means round down to the nearest whole number. For example, ⌊1.9⌋ is 1.)

Your Mission:
Given the magic level R, find the correct Floor F.
Input
A string R representing the magic level (contains a 64-bit integer).
Output
An integer F representing the floor number.
Constraints
0 ≤ F ≤ 80,000,000
0 ≤ R < 2^53
Example
Input
4
Output
2
